definitions.text:
Encamp
 [from camp.] To pitch tents or form huts, as an army; to halt on march, spread tents and remain for night or for longer time, as an army or company.
They encamped in Etham. Exodus 13:20.
The Levites shall encamp about the tabernacle. Numbers 1:50.
1. To pitch tents for the purpose of siege; to besiege.
ENCAMP against the city and take it. 2 Samuel 12:28.
ENCAMP',
To form into camp; to place marching army or company in temporary habitation or quarters.
